metadata.Description: The study of the economic aspects of energy production, consumption, and development.

level 1.Description: Energy and development economics address the issue of energy poverty and its impact on socio-economic development.
Energy and development economics employ cost-benefit analysis to evaluate the economic viability of sustainable energy projects.
Energy and development economics collaborate with international organizations to promote sustainable energy solutions globally.
Energy and development economics support research on renewable energy technologies and their potential for economic growth.
Energy and development economics administer energy subsidies to promote the adoption of clean and affordable energy sources.
Energy and development economics measure energy productivity to assess the efficiency of energy use in different sectors.
Energy and development economics align with the Sustainable Development Goals to ensure energy access and sustainability for all.
Energy and development economics is an interdisciplinary field that combines principles of economics and energy studies.

level 2.Subject: energy poverty indices
level 2.Description: Energy poverty indices implement energy access programs to provide affordable and reliable energy services to underserved communities.

level 2.Subject: energy poverty indices
level 2.Description: Energy poverty indices fund renewable energy projects to increase access to clean and sustainable energy sources.

level 2.Subject: regional energy organizations
level 2.Description: Regional energy organizations implement energy efficiency policies to promote sustainable energy practices.

level 2.Subject: regional energy organizations
level 2.Description: Regional energy organizations provide funding for renewable energy projects to support the transition to clean energy sources.

level 2.Subject: renewable energy agencies
level 2.Description: Renewable energy agencies employ experts in the field of renewable energy to drive innovation and promote the adoption of clean energy technologies.

level 2.Subject: renewable energy agencies
level 2.Description: Renewable energy agencies collaborate with research institutions to advance scientific knowledge and develop new technologies for renewable energy generation.

level 2.Subject: energy subsisides reform
level 2.Description: Energy subsidies reform addresses Energy Affordability by ensuring fair and efficient distribution of energy subsidies.

level 2.Subject: energy subsisides reform
level 2.Description: Energy subsidies reform employs Market-Based Pricing Mechanisms to promote efficient energy pricing and reduce market distortions.

level 3.Subject: renewable energy agencies
level 3.Description: Renewable energy agencies employ experts in the field of renewable energy to drive innovation and promote the adoption of clean energy technologies.

level 3.Subject: energy efficiency
level 3.Description: Energy efficiency measures address energy waste by promoting the use of energy-efficient technologies and practices.

level 3.Subject: energy and health
level 3.Description: Energy and health implements building standards that promote the use of energy-saving designs and materials.

level 3.Subject: energy markets
level 3.Description: Energy markets address the issue of energy access by ensuring the availability and affordability of energy sources for all segments of society.
